text:
Is it intentional that the search APIs (both CURL and graphql) will return 0 results if you search for a email for a contact if it has multiple emails assigned to one contact?

i.e. my HS contact has <mailto:thomas@aptitude8.com|thomas@aptitude8.com> and <mailto:thom@aptitude8.com|thom@aptitude8.com> but if I search for thom@aptitude8..com I get 0 results back
[removed_email]
Typo
The answer ended up being you have to search in the hs_additional_emails property
ah okay, glad you resolved it :slightly_smiling_face:
Thank you!
Are there any post and patch HubSpot api's to add *hs_additional_emails* in contacts rest API?

Hi <@U05RHRA9KL6> - apologies for the delayed response. Whenever you have a moment, could you submit this feedback via our developer feedback form: <https://share.hsforms.com/1pPqIw41PT6q8wklsLoHCZQ96it>
This way, we have a record of this. Thank you!
It’s a custom UI deal extension where I have custom objects that maintain complex relationships with line items
Ok.  Yeah...I think you are doing everything correctly.

Hi,
I have a published HubDB table with a select column. I would like to add more options to the dropdown. Other than manually adding each one, is there a endpoint I can hit to pass additional selection options? I want to add more, not override any existing.
I think you’d have to read first -> assign the current column values to a variable ->  push new values to the object/array containing the existing.
Sounds like this way I will override when I update though, is that correct?
I also dont want to lose any row data that previously selected items from that column
Hey all, new here. Can anyone confirm if it is possible to create a meeting scheduling page via the API? I don't think its currently available in the API, but I would love to confirm. Thank you!

Hi Guys :smile:

I'm running into an issue with editing a form through the API. I was able to make one edit just fine, but when I tried to edit it again, I got this error:

```{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Form is out of date, form has been modified by another user, please refresh",
    "correlationId": "9e932683-c171-4a04-98eb-56912fb8e521",
    "type": "CONCURRENT_UPDATE_BY_USER",
    "exceptionType": "CONCURRENT_UPDATE_BY_USER"
}```
It says there's a “concurrent update,” but no one else is editing the form. Could you help me figure out what’s going on so I can keep making updates?

Thanks!

Hi there, it looks like there’s a lot going on, but I hope you can help. We have a custom form on our site, and are submitting the data through the Forms API V3 - everything works until we try to *upload files.*

We upload the files first to HubSpot using another API, once completed, we take the `file ID` and include that into the submit API call like this:

```{
 "objectTypeId": "0-1",
 "name": "cv",
 "type": "string",
 "fieldType": "file",
 "value": "188299979124"
}```
*The file, the pdf is there, can be opened*
• by checking the newly created Contact itself, 
• or by navigating to the files menu
*But the submission can’t be rendered. We see a HTTP 500.*

*Any ideas why?*

hey gang, anyone have any issues getting webhook subscriptions to actually get created from a Project + App (e.g. UI Extensions + Public App setup)?

I've got the webhooks file registered in the project source code but when I upload/deploy there are no subscriptions created
and yes I do have the file registered under the `public-app.json` file here:

Hey guys, stupid question, I added the tracker script to my website, but the HubSpotConversations object is still undefined. The chatflow is setup alright on HubSpot dashboard. Am I missing something?

Hey all - would love any guidance:

*Context:*
• I'm developing a Chrome Extension which enables uses to add companies/contacts to their HubSpot, add contacts directly to HubSpot sequences, and create a task in HubSpot
• For the first time, I'm running into issues with users not having certain permissions (scopes). These users are not Super Admins
• My feeling is that some applications can operate by just having a Super Admin be the one that authenticates on behalf of the company (ex. Airtable), but other applications (like mine) it's more appropriate for each user to individually authenticate since they might use the extension where others at there team/company do not. 
    ◦ The guidance I've come across so far doesn't seem to acknowledge this difference, so hoping to hear advice that takes into consideration my playing field. That said, maybe this bullet point is just wrong and the best advice applies to both ◡̈ 
*Question:*
• What's the norms or best practices here? 
• Is there some documentation around which scopes are commonly available to employees vs. those that would generally not be something that most would have access to?
• If there some documentation that makes it clear what specific toggles a Super Admin must enable to ensure that the appropriate permissions are met to meet the scopes requirement?
-----
:zombie: Endlessly wrestling with this, particularly frustrating to navigate. Genuine appreciation for anyone that can provide any insight on the questions, or whatever you feel could help me get on solid footing. Will screenshot the scopes I currently believe are the minimum necessary to use all our functionality. Moved most to "optional" just to unblock users from using our baseline functionality.

Hi!
We are trying to connect HubSpot to our internal Data Base, so we need that if a status changes to a certain status (onboarding) it triggers an internal process that creates a merchant and fills certain fields in our DB.
I was thinking on using the endpoint Read a batch of deals by internal ID or unique property values, but I have a few questions:
1. Is this the best EP?
2. if yes, where should we put and how, that instruction, when a deal changes to Onboarding?
Guess you can set up a workflow that sends the deal to your external DB when a deal status changes.
